briefdescription.para: The transform that should contain all the guinodes
We need to change the orthographic size of both cameras at the same time, so we the change by using this property
Makes the dragged nodes snap to the background grid when moved
The main camera that will see the canvas
The zoom percentage of the camera (1.0 to 0.3)

Calcualtes a bounding box using all the nodes in the scene and sets it as the allowed area for the camera This method is currently called whenever a node has finally been set in place. And when a missions was just loaded. There should be a way to avoid recalculating the bounding box each placement, but due to time constraints I couldnt do it.
This is the Fit-In-View method. Will make all the nodes of the mission fit inside the camera frustrum
This is the Fit-In-View method. Will make all the nodes of the mission fit inside the camera frustrum

parameterdescription.para: Set to True to clamp the zoom to the configured max
Set to True to clamp the zoom to the configured max

briefdescription.para: Will Refit the Canvas camera to the currently Selected Nodes on the Canvas.
Will Refit the Canvas camera to the currently Selected Nodes on the Canvas.

parameterdescription.para: Set to True to clamp the zoom to the configured max
Set to True to clamp the zoom to the configured max

briefdescription.para: Focus the Canvas on the passed in MEGUINode position and sets zoom level to 1.
Sets the camera to target the start node, and sets the zoom to the maximium value
Returns the cursor position into localspace of the nodecanvas
Runs once, used to initialize events and ui callbacks

parameterdescription.para: The reference to the MissionEditor logic

briefdescription.para: Ondestroy will unsucribe from the appropiate events.
The event when the mouse is dragged along the screen. Used to pan the camera around.
When a mission loads, this event will be called to reset the state of the editor.
The event when the canvas is clicked, will be redirected to the EditorLogic
The event when the mouse is held down. Used to store the dragging starting values
The event when the mouse button is released. Used to panning the camera
The event when the scroll wheel is used over the node canvas. Its mainly used for zoom in/out
Tests if the mouse pointer is inside the canvas area
Clears any movement that was caused from dragginc a canvas to the edge of the active area
Prevents the mouse wheel to change the zoom distance of the canvas
Tests if the canvas can be moved to the edges when dragging a node

parameterdescription.para: The node being scrolled in the edge

briefdescription.para: Given a position within the canvas, returns a new position adjusted within the allowed bounds.

parameterdescription.para: A local positio within the canvas

simplesect.para: A new adjusted position within bounds

memberdef.argsstring: (MEGUINode guiNode, ref Vector2 maxBounds, ref Vector2 minBounds)
memberdef.name: GetNodeBounds

briefdescription.para: Retuns a bounding box for a nodes dimensions on the screen. This is used for automatically adjusting the size of the canvas in the editor.

parameterdescription.para: The node to calculate the bounds from
The bounds for the top right corner
The bounds for the bottom left corner

briefdescription.para: When the camera is scrolled in, an slight offset is applied for it to focus whats under the cursor. This method will return this offset should be done calculated from the center of the screen.

simplesect.para: A direction vector towars wich to focus the next scroll movement

briefdescription.para: This method will check if any of the zoom buttons in the UI has to be disabled (if a value is maxed out)
Set the Zoom to a new percentage (value will be clamped to within min and max).
Handles increments and decremetns of the camera zoom
Callback method for the zoom in button in the editor
Callback method for the zoom out button in the editor
Used to resize the line width
This method will clamp the given position to the grid if the SnapToGrid setting is true. Otherwise retunrs the same position

parameterdescription.para: The position that is required to be clamped by the SnapToGrid function if able

simplesect.para: A position adjusted if SnapToGrid is set to true, otherwise the same that was given.
